title: LLMs-as-Judges: A Survey on LLM-based Evaluation Methods and Their Ethical Implications

sections.description: Introduce the concept of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their emerging role as evaluators in various domains. Discuss the significance of using LLMs in evaluation, particularly in natural language processing tasks. Outline the scope of the paper, including the focus on AI ethics and automated decision-making.

subsections.description: Provide a brief introduction to LLMs, highlighting their development and importance in modern AI applications.
Discuss the importance of LLMs in evaluation tasks and their potential impact on various domains.
Define the boundaries of the survey, focusing on LLMs as evaluators and the ethical considerations involved.
Provide an overview of the paper's organization and the key topics covered in each section.

sections.description: Provide a detailed explanation of the core concepts related to LLMs, including their architecture and capabilities. Discuss the role of LLMs in natural language processing and their potential as evaluators.

subsections.description: Explain the technical architecture of LLMs and their capabilities in processing and generating language.
Discuss how LLMs are utilized in natural language processing tasks and their effectiveness.
Introduce key terms such as AI ethics and automated decision-making, and explain their relevance to the topic.

sections.description: Explore various methods and approaches for using LLMs as evaluators. Discuss the advantages and limitations of these methods.

subsections.description: Explore different evaluation methods using LLMs and the challenges faced in their implementation.

Examine the benchmarks and performance metrics used to assess LLM-based evaluations.
